chapter.title: Capabilities
chapter.para:
The rel="capabilities" link obtained from the entry point URI (see ) allows information about the supported capabilities of this instance of RHEV-M to be queried. The capabilities element contains any number of version elements which describe capabilities which are dependent on the cluster version level. The version element may contain the following information:
major The major version number
minor The minor version number
current Whether this is the most recent supported cluster version level
cpus The list of supported CPU types. See
For example:
chapter.screen:
GET /capabilities HTTP/1.1 Accept: application/xml
HTTP/1.1 200 OK Content-Type: application/xml
<capabilities> <version major="2" minor="2"> <current/> <cpus> ... </cpus> ... </version> <version major="2" minor="1"> <cpus> ... </cpus> ... </version> </capabilities>

section.title: CPUs
section.para: Each cluster is configured with a minimal CPU type which all hosts in that cluster must support. Guests running on hosts within the cluster all run on this CPU type, ensuring that every guest can be live migrated to any host within the cluster.

RHEV has a set of supported CPU types to choose from when configuring a cluster. Each CPU has the following properties:
id An opaque identifier for the CPU model
level An indication as to the relative priority/preference for the CPUs in the list. Higher is better
flags A list of the CPU flags supported by the CPU
For example:
section.screen: <capabilities> <cpus> <cpu id="Intel Xeon w/o XD/NX"> <level>2</level> <flags> <flag>vmx</flag> <flag>sse2</flag> </flags> </cpu> <cpu id="Intel Xeon"> <level>3</level> <flags> <flag>vmx</flag> <flag>sse2</flag> <flag>nx</flag> </flags> </cpu> ... </cpus> ... </capabilities>
